definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Surrealistic film occurred in France in 1920s.
sentences.chinese: 1920年代，法国兴起了超现实主义电影。

sentences.english: Even without the gorgeous backdrop, skydiving is surreal.
sentences.chinese: 甚至除去那华丽的背景，跳伞都是超现实主义的。

sentences.english: Magritte, a Belgian painter, is a representative of Superrealistic painters.
sentences.chinese: 马格里特，比利时画家，超现实主义的代表之一。

sentences.english: Financial markets the past two months turned surrealistic on me.
sentences.chinese: 对我而言，前两个月的金融市场是超现实主义的。
人们称这种风格为超现实主义。

sentences.english: Certain pieces have more of a tangible surrealistic influence.
sentences.chinese: 而另一些作品则更为可触知的超现实主义。

sentences.english: I have a preference for surrealistic novels.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢看超现实主义的小说。

sentences.english: He derided the surrealists as 'leaders of modernistic imbecility'.
sentences.chinese: 他嘲笑超现实主义画家是“现代主义低能”的领导者。

sentences.english: It focus on the historical background of surrealism characteristics of the times.
sentences.chinese: 即着眼于超现实主义的历史背景时代特征。

sentences.english: This is day dream-like surrealistic section.
sentences.chinese: 这是一段白日梦似的超现实主义段落。

sentences.english: This is a far, far reach from French surrealism.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个超现实主义的法国人。

sentences.english: Most of the images of French surrealism don't have a center.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的法国超现实主义想像没有一个中心。

sentences.english: These all sound like surrealistic, dreamy scenes from fiction.
sentences.chinese: 这些听上去像是小说中超现实主义的梦幻之境。

definition: Futurism (artistic and social movement of the 20th century)
